title: Bunnings puts new Melbourne warehouse on the market
text:
Bunnings has put a new large-format warehouse in Clyde North in Melbourne's south-east up for sale in a rare sale-and-leaseback offering.

The 16,634 square metre retail warehouse and 372-vehicle car park will be sold with a new 12-year lease in place, bringing in net income of circa $1.9 million per annum.

Based on a yield of around 5 per cent struck for other similar Bunnings assets it could be worth around $38 million.

The Clyde North Bunnings is on Berwick-Cranbourne Road and fronts developer MAB Corp's Element Park, a 30-hectare master planned business and retail park.

Title deeds show Bunnings Property settled on the 3.77-hectare site on October 1 after buying it from MAB Corp in December 2017.
description: The 16,634 square metre building will be sold with a new 12-year lease to the Wesfarmers-owned large format retail chain.
